snippet.textDisplay:
Reading/Watching Berserk makes me feel depressed, desperate, sad and angry.
That's why it's one of the best Mangas ever made.
It succeeds at its job, you care for the characters, you actually like the main protagonist and cheer for him, which doesn't happen a lot in most of Shonen related Mangas and you despise the antagonist for his actions because he is not just a cool badass who outshines the hero or a stereotypical villain who likes to laugh a lot because... evil people laugh a lot.
snippet.textOriginal:
Reading/Watching Berserk makes me feel depressed, desperate, sad and angry.
That's why it's one of the best Mangas ever made.
It succeeds at its job, you care for the characters, you actually like the main protagonist and cheer for him, which doesn't happen a lot in most of Shonen related Mangas and you despise the antagonist for his actions because he is not just a cool badass who outshines the hero or a stereotypical villain who likes to laugh a lot because... evil people laugh a lot.

snippet.textDisplay: KTBMedia This game covers a certain arc of the manga, Millennium Falcon Arc. Right now the manga is the only source material this game has but season 2 of Berserk (2016) should cover this too.

snippet.textDisplay:
Berserk was pretty much the progenitor of the Souls series, a lot of stuff from Berserk is mirrored in Demons' Souls and Dark Souls 1.

If From ever did an official Berserk game, it would be entirely appropriate and things would come full circle.
snippet.textOriginal:
Berserk was pretty much the progenitor of the Souls series, a lot of stuff from Berserk is mirrored in Demons' Souls and Dark Souls 1.

If From ever did an official Berserk game, it would be entirely appropriate and things would come full circle.

snippet.textDisplay:
If anyone is interested in an English translation patch for this game Google search 'Kirameki translations'. 
Go to the first link and show your support by voting 'Berserk' in the polls. Fingers crossed the game should be fully translated to English!! :)
PM if you would like links to the threads I have created in the Berserk community forums to help encourage this project, and please spread the word =D
snippet.textOriginal:
If anyone is interested in an English translation patch for this game Google search 'Kirameki translations'. 
Go to the first link and show your support by voting 'Berserk' in the polls. Fingers crossed the game should be fully translated to English!! :)
PM if you would like links to the threads I have created in the Berserk community forums to help encourage this project, and please spread the word =D

snippet.textDisplay: I know nothing about this game but what I've just seen, but from what I've seen I need to see more. I make a comic strip called Todd & The Shining Sword, and seeing those bright streaks reminded me of Todd's Shining Sword, and I got to thinking: Todd needs to learn some moves from this guy, but modify them to fit his fighting style. Like Ken and Ryu both know the Hadoken and Shoryuken, but have different ways they perform each as they developed different ways after Street Fighter 2 World Warrior
snippet.textOriginal: I know nothing about this game but what I've just seen, but from what I've seen I need to see more. I make a comic strip called Todd & The Shining Sword, and seeing those bright streaks reminded me of Todd's Shining Sword, and I got to thinking: Todd needs to learn some moves from this guy, but modify them to fit his fighting style. Like Ken and Ryu both know the Hadoken and Shoryuken, but have different ways they perform each as they developed different ways after Street Fighter 2 World Warrior

snippet.textDisplay:
@gathimest
Many, if not most, manga starts off with a One shot, and then get built upon that. The real serielization of the Berserker did indeed start however in 1990. So you are right in that concept. :)

Praise and praise, we barely knew about Berserker due to Darkhorse little attempt of keeping it constricted outside of Asia. =/

Hate that. And I want the god damn Anime to show the REAL Berserker Manga, an OVA compared to that half decent attempt they did. -.-
snippet.textOriginal:
@gathimest
Many, if not most, manga starts off with a One shot, and then get built upon that. The real serielization of the Berserker did indeed start however in 1990. So you are right in that concept. :)

Praise and praise, we barely knew about Berserker due to Darkhorse little attempt of keeping it constricted outside of Asia. =/

Hate that. And I want the god damn Anime to show the REAL Berserker Manga, an OVA compared to that half decent attempt they did. -.-

snippet.textDisplay:
the Beast? You mean the wolfhound within Gutts?
Yeah I agree with the slight offtastedness when the story moved into the Schierke arc. That was alright, but when each secondary character got a magic weapon/armor... all of a sudden... I guess Miura had no choice but to have them survive he had to be a conspicuous deus ex machina and give them such weapons.
snippet.textOriginal:
the Beast? You mean the wolfhound within Gutts?
Yeah I agree with the slight offtastedness when the story moved into the Schierke arc. That was alright, but when each secondary character got a magic weapon/armor... all of a sudden... I guess Miura had no choice but to have them survive he had to be a conspicuous deus ex machina and give them such weapons.

snippet.textDisplay:
Godot was previously the blacksmith of a king, but fell out of favor when he forged the unelegant Dragon Slayer, as a contest among blacksmiths to create a sword capable of killing a dragon.

Pretty much he made a huge ass sword as a joke, but when Guts came in contact with him after the Eclipse he was able to wield it just fine and is a nessesary weapon in order to slay such mythological creatures. 

Play the game and you'll find that you'll only scar a dragon with the blade
snippet.textOriginal:
Godot was previously the blacksmith of a king, but fell out of favor when he forged the unelegant Dragon Slayer, as a contest among blacksmiths to create a sword capable of killing a dragon.

Pretty much he made a huge ass sword as a joke, but when Guts came in contact with him after the Eclipse he was able to wield it just fine and is a nessesary weapon in order to slay such mythological creatures. 

Play the game and you'll find that you'll only scar a dragon with the blade

snippet.textDisplay: To kill some big ass monsters.
snippet.textOriginal: To kill some big ass monsters.
